name: Lost Lad and Back Tor (Ethels), High Peak

ai.summary: A demanding 20.3 km circular hike to Lost Lad and Back Tor in the High Peak area. This hard route traverses rocky paths, exposed moorland, and steep ascents, with potential boggy sections and rewarding views across the Derbyshire countryside.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of rocky, uneven trails, grassy moorland sections, intermittent stone steps, and occasional muddy bogginess. Some parts are exposed with thin footing and short scrambles; navigation is important as not all paths are clearly marked. Prepared for long distances with frequent ascents and descents.
ai.safety_notes: Distance and elevation demand good fitness; weather can change rapidly in the Peak District, so carry waterproofs and extra layers. Wear sturdy footwear with good grip, bring a map and compass (and know how to use them) or a reliable GPS. Pack enough water and food, sun protection in clear weather, a hat for sun or cold, and a headlamp for late finishes. Tell someone your route and expected return, and consider emergency gear such as a whistle and space blanket. Be mindful of boggy sections and keep to established paths to protect the environment.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Maps and compass (or reliable GPS) and know-how to use them
Hat and gloves for cold or windy conditions
First aid kit tailored to a long hike
Mobile phone with offline maps and emergency contact plan
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May to September) offers the best weather and daylight for a 20.3 km hard hike. Autumn provides clear views but shorter days; winter can be challenging due to ice, wind, and fading light—plan accordingly and consider shorter alternatives in poor conditions.

seo.title: Lost Lad and Back Tor (Ethels) – High Peak, UK | 20.3 km Hard Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the challenging 20.3 km route to Lost Lad and Back Tor in the High Peak. This guide covers terrain, safety tips, gear, and the best seasons for a demanding UK hike.
